root.name: line()
root.description: A line is a direct path between two points. The version of line() with four parameters draws the line in the XY plane at Z=0. The version with six parameters allows the line to be placed anywhere within XYZ space. To color a line, use the stroke() function. A line cannot be filled, therefore the fill() method will not affect the color of a line. Lines are drawn with a width of one pixel.
root.syntax: line(x1, y1, x2, y2); line(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2);

parameter.label: x1
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: y1
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: z1
parameter.description: int or float: z-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: x2
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: y2
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: z2
parameter.description: int or float: z-coordinate of the second point
